content: The "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines terms like "Federal land" and "Hazardous substance" in relation to the project site. It also mentions the Henderson Redevelopment Agency in Nevada. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms related to the Three Kids Mine Project, such as "map," "Responsible Party," "Secretary," "State," and "Three Kids Mine Project Site." These definitions are crucial for understanding the project and its stakeholders. The Three Kids Mine Project Site includes Federal land and adjacent non-Federal land, depicted on a map. The Secretary will convey the Federal land to the Henderson Redevelopment Agency once conditions are met, with payment required. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will pay the fair market value of the Federal land based on an appraisal conducted according to nationally recognized standards. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will pay fair market value for the Federal land based on nationally recognized appraisal standards. The Secretary will estimate costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must be based on a comprehensive study approved by the State and conducted according to ASTM International Standard E-2137-06 (2011). The Phase II environmental site assessment must follow ASTM International Standards E-1527-05 and E-1903-11. The Secretary will review cost information provided by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, Responsible Party, and State for estimating costs. If there is a disagreement, parties will select experts to assist in making the final cost estimate. The Secretary will begin the appraisal and cost estimates within 30 days of the Act's enactment. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimated remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance under subsection (a) is contingent on the Secretary receiving a written agreement from the State. The Secretary must receive a written mine remediation and reclamation agreement from the State, and concur within 30 days that the requirements have been met. The agreement must be enforceable and obligate the Responsible Party to perform after the conveyance of Federal land. The conveyance of Federal land under this Act includes remediation and reclamation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site to protect human health and the environment from hazardous substances. The agreement must include financial assurance provisions for the completion of the remedy. As a condition of the conveyance, the Secretary must accept a written mine remediation and reclamation agreement within 90 days. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must notify the Secretary of their readiness to accept the Federal land conveyance. The Federal land is withdrawn from various activities for a 10-year period, subject to existing rights. The Bureau of Reclamation relinquishes Federal land no longer needed, allowing for immediate conveyance. Existing water infrastructure rights holders are not affected. Adjustments to ACEC boundaries are made. The boundary of the River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern is adjusted to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. Responsibilities for mine remediation and reclamation will apply to the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada after conveyance. The Secretary's responsibility for responding to hazardous substance releases is affected, and laws regarding environmental protection and public health are not modified by the Southern Nevada Public Lands Management Act of 1998.
